Ad Text:
The Company

Our client is a global business that's all about building new features and constantly improving their product. The business is high performing, and you'll lead an engineering team working on a modern platform, which currently supports B2B and is set to expand across all lines of business. The team develops and operates an event-driven, microservices architecture running on Kubernetes, leveraging Terraform, Kafka, and CI/CD pipelines to enable true continuous delivery. You'll champion the thoughtful use of AI-assisted engineering to enhance quality, speed, and developer experience, while ensuring these tools are adopted responsibly and securely.


The Role

In this dynamic role, you'll take on new challenges daily, using your process-driven approach and innovative mindset to drive continuous improvement. Working closely with key stakeholders, you will build trust through strong technical expertise and a genuine commitment to your team's growth. You provide clear technical direction, remain hands-on when it matters, and cultivate a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement. To succeed, you'll need strong knowledge of systems, technology, and data, along with a curiosity for improving the platform. With ongoing consumer feedback, the product will evolve through continuous iterations.

Your Skills & Experience

2+ years leading software engineering teams
10+ years of professional software development experience
Proven ability to build strong team cultures with high standards and strong support
Deep experience with modern engineering practices, cloud platforms, and DevOps, including automated testing and deployments
Strong knowledge of microservices, distributed systems, and data-intensive applications
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


Technical Skills

.NET/C# and TypeScript
Cloud-native development: Kubernetes, Terraform, Terragrunt, Containerisation
Event streaming with Kafka
Modern frontend technologies (Angular)
CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code
Database technologies and data management practices
AI-assisted developer tools and LLM-based services


About You

You have exceptional technical know-how and a real passion for the end-to-end solutions that drive the user experience and customer happiness. You will have effective written and oral communication skills for use in a complex project environment.


What's on offer?

A true career opportunity with a rapidly growing company.
Extensive opportunities to grow your skill set and enjoy career growth.
The camaraderie of an energetic, highly talented team of innovators.
A company that rewards perfection and champion work-life balance.


Robert Half Ltd is committed to equal opportunity and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of categories protected under local law.

The Opportunity 

Boeing Technology Innovation (BTI) supports the future growth and profitability of Boeing Australia's businesses and the broader Boeing enterprise. This advanced research and development arm creates future aerospace solutions while improving the cycle time, cost, quality and performance of current systems.

We are currently looking for a Software Engineer to join the team located in Brisbane. 

As a Software Engineer within BDA, you will:

Be a part of an innovation-focused, multi-disciplinary R&D capability within The Boeing Company working on challenges spanning the gamut of future technologies in aerospace.
Operate within a larger ecosystem of engineering, including flight autonomy, mission autonomy, mission systems, devops and flight testing.
Develop, integrate, and maintain software that will be deployed on operational platforms under the guidance of senior engineers.
Build an understanding of the application context and the practical constraints that influence technical solutions; ask questions and seek clarification from domain experts.
Produce clear, reviewable technical artefacts (code, design notes, test plans) for review by cross-functional stakeholders.
Support verification, validation and release activities tied to operational acceptance; execute test cases, document results, and fix issues under supervision.
Collaborate with other engineers, testers, systems engineers and product owners; represent your work within the team and escalate issues when needed.
Practice good software engineering habits: write readable code, add unit tests, follow code review feedback, and follow security and maintainability best practices.
Participate in an agile software development process: attend planning, stand-ups and retrospectives; estimate and commit to work items.
Make informed decisions and take effective action in the presence of uncertainty and incomplete information; adapt with agility as the situation evolves.
Be an Australian citizen and hold, or have the ability to obtain, a minimum NV-1 Australian Defence security clearance.

About you

To be successful in this role you will have:

Required:

Tertiary qualification in software engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, mechatronics, aerospace engineering, or related disciplines.
Two (2) or more years of experience in professional engineering roles (or equivalent combination of higher degree and professional experience).
Ability to work both independently on assigned tasks and collaboratively within a cross-disciplinary team.
Strong software language proficiency (Python, C++ are highly desirable).
Clear technical communication skills (both written and verbal).
Demonstrated ability to reason about real-world constraints and to translate them into practical software or algorithmic steps.
Natural curiosity and a commitment to continuous learning.

Desirable:

Internship, project or coursework experience in autonomous systems, robotics or related applications.
Experience with scientific computing, data analysis, or simulation tools.
Research higher degree or relevant project portfolio (e.g., senior capstone, open-source contributions).

Benefits

Flexible working options
Study assistance
Salary packaging
Employee Incentive Program              
Global opportunities

How to apply
